comments:
If you close a JPA project that has entities open, you'll get exceptions in the error log:

java.lang.NullPointerException
at org.eclipse.dali.core.util.jdt.ASTTools.getAnnotation(ASTTools.java:101)
at org.eclipse.dali.orm.adapters.java.Member.getAnnotation(Member.java:94)
at org.eclipse.dali.orm.adapters.java.Member.getAnnotation(Member.java:90)

at org.eclipse.dali.orm.adapters.java.JavaPersistentTypeModelAdapter.postUpdatePersModel(JavaPersistentTypeModelAdapter.java:122)

at org.eclipse.dali.orm.impl.PersistenceModelManager$ElementChangeProcessor.elementChanged(PersistenceModelManager.java:411)
at org.eclipse.dali.orm.impl.PersistenceModelManager$ElementChangeListener.elementChanged(PersistenceModelManager.java:378)
at org.eclipse.jdt.internal.core.DeltaProcessor$3.run(DeltaProcessor.java:1444)

at org.eclipse.ui.editors.text.TextFileDocumentProvider.disconnect(TextFileDocumentProvider.java:626)


It seems that we are not cleaning up our model when a project is closed.
I am also experiencing this problem.  But, not with all of my Projects.  The Kodo tutorial examples exhibit this behaviour on every close.  Thanks.
I am no longer able to reproduce this bug. Please include a project or test case that exhibits the problem if you reopen the bug.  I also tried this with the Kodo examples
Closing as part of mass query to clean up old resolved bugs in untargetted milestones.
